alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clinton; Hamilton; Hancock; Johnson; Marion; Shelby; Tipton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 2:28AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Shelby, western Hancock, southeastern Clinton, northeastern Johnson, Marion, eastern Boone, Hamilton and southwestern Tipton Counties through 300 AM EDT... At 227 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Georgetown to Franklin. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Franklin around 235 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Noblesville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 86 and 118. Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 211. Interstate 70 between mile markers 78 and 97. Interstate 74 between mile markers 93 and 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Clinton; Hamilton; Hancock; Johnson; Marion; Shelby; Tipton
